TopicTitle: MSI Afterburner Causing Crash On Startup

Articles.Content:
I've been playing KSP for almost a year. I only use a few mods:

  • SVE
  • MechJeb
  • Alarm Clock
  • Scatterer
  • Reentry Particle Effect
  • EVE

I have not had a problem lauching the game.

Recently I have acquired a new GPU, and have been using MSI Afterburner to keep a track of temps, and other stuff.

KSP crashes on launch every time if I have MSI Afterburner, and Riva Statistics running.

Does anyone else have this issue, or does anyone have a workaround? Seeing the stats that I like to see isn't a HUGE priority, but I do enjoy seeing system temps.

When I exit MSI Afternburner, the game launches without a problem.

Also, the game crashes when I boot into 64 bit from steam, but if I go into the game files, and launch the x64 from the application in my hard drive files, it boots.

1 hour ago, Tizop said:

Does anyone else have this issue, or does anyone have a workaround?

Rivatuner is known to crash KSP,  it messes with directx to insert it's overlay. The only workaround I know of is not running rivatuner.
Afterburner isn't the issue indeed. I run it too and have no problem with it.

On 10/1/2017 at 12:50 AM, steve_v said:

Rivatuner is known to crash KSP,  it messes with directx to insert it's overlay. The only workaround I know of is not running rivatuner.

 

On 10/1/2017 at 3:58 PM, DrLicor said:

Afterburner isn't the issue indeed. I run it too and have no problem with it.

 

I forgot to mention that a few days ago I was playing with AfterBurner enable, as well as the Riva Stats enabled. I was having no problems playing, then all of a sudden I was having crashes on startup. This issue has also started to effect my other games as well.
